intro: Pavetta somaliensis, commonly known as the Somali pavetta, is a shrub native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features small, elliptical leaves that are typically arranged oppositely along the stems. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and are usually white or pale pink, attracting various pollinators. The fruit is a small, smooth capsule that contains several seeds.
